result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle H. Thacker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $300.00 fine plus costs. Fine and costs are paid in full.
--------------------------------

Pay restitution in the amount of $240.43. Restitution has been paid in full and shall be disbursed to the victim through the Clerk of Courts Office.
--------------------------------

Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge.
--------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
--------------------------------

The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
--------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before November 7, 2014 @ 8:00 am.
The defendant is to complete a total of forty (40) hours community service work during his period of probation with NO BUYOUT.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs including mandatory DNA surcharge pursuant to Sec.973.046(1r), Wis. Stats. Court costs are paid in full.
--------------------------------

Defendant Kyle H. Thacker in court with attorney Francis R Lettenberger.  Haley J Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle H. Thacker in court with attorney Francis R. Lettenberger.  Joshua P. Grube appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Not guilty plea entered. Speedy trial waived.  Status conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

1002 am case called. Appearances made.
Defendant Kyle H. Thacker in court with attorney Frank Lettenberger.  Haley Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised of right to & waived prelim. Charge/penalties explained. Court ordered defendant bound over. Information filed. Court schedules arraignment before Judge Reddy. 
1005 am court in recess. 
  Arraignment scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH M.E.S. OR THE PIGGLY WIGGLY STORE, LAKE GENEVA, WI OR ITS EMPLOYEES. NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR STEPHEN MICHAEL BELL.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Cash component removed new bond set
